subject: Economics
title: Thomas Piketty: Capital in the Twenty-First Century
description: Learn Thomas Piketty: Capital in the Twenty-First Century in one minute.

hook.text: A French economist wrote a 700-page book about inequality. It sold 2.5 million copies and terrified billionaires.

buildup.text: Piketty gathered 200 years of tax data from 20+ countries.

twist.text: Critics attacked his data, his methodology, and his conclusions.

climax.text: Piketty showed that extreme inequality isn't a bug in capitalism.

punchline.text: r > g: two letters that explain why the rich keep getting richer.

quiz.question: What does Piketty's formula 'r > g' mean?
options: When returns on capital exceed economic growth, inequality naturally increases
Rich countries grow faster than poor ones
